intro: Vanoverberghia sepulchrei, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and unique plant native to the Western Cape of South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its distinctive adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pale pink or white, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils.
